preface.para: Lyahvi is the magic of the air, of the insubstantial, the invisible, the ethereal, and the illusory. Lyahvian magi are manipulators of light: reflection, refraction and confusion, with effects faster than the eye and difficult to describe.

They are masters of air and other gases, of sound (which travels on the air), and they can summon Asiri and other ethereals to their benefit. The Lyahvi nemesis is earth, represented by the convocation of Fyvria. The essence of Lyahvi is bright, sterile and unliving. Secondary: Peleahn, Savorya. Tertiary: Jmorvi, Odivshe. Diametric: Fyvria.

description.para: The spell is placed upon an object, which may be the caster, another creature or an inanimate object. All sound near that point is muffled, and perception tasks are at +5 difficulty to hear sounds from the target. The spell effects anything within a metre radius of the target point.

Summons a sapient element of Lyahvi, which appears as a small mote of light, about as bright as a candle flame. The elemental has limited intelligence, but can follow simple instructions. It cannot pass through solid matter, but can travel as much as 25m away from the caster. If it is commanded to travel further than this, then control over it will be lost. It can see and hear, though cannot understand any speech other than its elemental language, and will have difficulty telling mundane creatures apart. All communication with the elemental is speech, in the tongue of the lyahvian element. Opposed Will rolls must be made when the sprite is summoned in order to control it. The sprite will have a will of one.

spell.name: Aeric's Whisper
spell.boost: +10 Message need not be spoken aloud

description.para: When cast, the caster's voice is carried to a designated spot within line of sight. The voice travels the intervening distance, though in a reasonably tight beam. The spell lasts for one round.

Causes the air around the target point to glow softly, with as much light as a torch. If the target is an object, then the light will move with that object. Sentients get a will roll to resist the spell if they are made the target. The more powerful incantations of this spell can increase the range of the spell, or the brightness.
The caster traces out shapes on a surface, leaving a glowing mark which can be simple shapes, or complex writing. The runes can be written in the air, or on a solid object.

This spell creates an illusory image of a ghostly, humanoid apparition. It cannot be made to look like a particular person, and it is perfectly stationary. It is obviously 'not real', being mostly transparent. It is an awareness difficulty of 10 to notice it as an illusion. The animated version of the illusion is merely a repetitive animation - it is set when the spell is cast and cannot be changed.

Creates a glowing point of light, about as bright as a candle, which starts at the designated point, and can be moved around by the caster. The light can be sent travelling in a direction, and it will keep going until it exceeds the range of the spell, or the caster stops concentrating. The light cannot move through solid objects.

spell.name: Seldon's Guard
spell.boost: +30 A movement pattern can be preset

description.para: Creates an illusion of a person. The illusion can be animated, and looks reasonably real - an awareness difficulty of 30 to notice flaws. The illusion can make quiet noises, though is not capable of speech.

spell.name: Loris' Glowing Orb
spell.boost: +30 Brightness can be varied from candle to bonfire

description.para: Creates a globe of light which is under the caster's control, and which may be moved anywhere within the range of the spell. The lit area must remain in sight of the caster at all times. The base globe is as bright as a torch.

Modifies sound making it clearer and generally more pleasant. The upshot is that the target of the spell gets a +5 bonus to skill rolls involving sound, such as speaking, singing or playing a musical instrument.
Hides an inanimate object, giving -5 penalty to spot it. Normally, the difficulty to spot an object in a room is 15 - 3 x size of the object, higher if viewer is distracted.

Causes a bright flash of light, which can blind those looking at it. A perception roll is made at difficulty 20, and if failed, a -5 penalty is suffered to actions for the next minute. Creatures suffer a -5 to the resistance rolls in gloomy conditions, and -10 in dark conditions (due to loss of night vision).

Shapes the appearance of an object up to size 6 in minor ways. The colour, exact shape or size can be changed, though the basic structure of the object will still be the same. The object can be 50% bigger or smaller (though no larger than size 6). A glass could become a vase, a dog a cat etc. If the object moves, the spell is broken. The change is a visual illusion only - touch, smell or sound is not effected.

Affects the eyesight of the target, granting them great sensitivity to light. The target receives a +15 bonus to vision based perception rolls, which is used to offset any darkness penalties. However, if the bonus is more than the darkness penalty, then the bonus becomes a penalty. Someone in daylight suffers a -15 penalty. Someone in twilight, with a -5 penalty, now has a -10 penalty (the first 5 points offsets the -5, then the remaining 10 points become a new penalty).
Creates a glowing ball of flashing light above the head of the caster. Any within range who looks towards the caster must make a perception roll of 25+ or suffer a penalty to all actions of -10.

Creates a still, purely optical, illusion. In order to spot that it is an illusion requires a perception x awareness roll of 25 + 1 / 10m of distance, though the fact that it does not move tends to be a give away. The illusion can be of any three dimensional object up to size 6. More powerful castings of this spell may allow the illusion to be animated. The animation must be a simple and repetitive (such as rippling cloak or hair).

spell.name: Sight of Castranel
spell.boost: +60 Can grant ability to touched target

description.para: Allows the caster to see clearly through air ignoring all weather effects up to the range of the spell. Does not grant ability to see in darkness.

A blinding, burning beam of light shoots forth from the caster's hand, automatically hitting the specified target within range. If a perception roll of 25+ is not made, the target is blinded for one hour per point failed by. On a fumble, they are blinded permanently. The beam also burns, causing +10 damage.
Creates an image of an object being touched within range of the spell. Difficulty to spot as an illusion is 40. Can be cast on any inanimate object up to size 12.

Reveals any ethereal, illusory or invisible objects or creatures as they really are. Sapient creatures get an opposed will roll to resist the effects of this spell, all freestanding illusions are automatically seen through.

Changes 40,000 litres of air into stale, difficult to breathe, air. 40K litres is about equivalent to a small room. The spell is normally centred on the caster. Higher incantations of this spell can make the air poisonous, which requires a stamina roll of 30+ each round to avoid nausea or sickness, and a -15 penalty.
Turns an amount of inanimate material ethereal, allowing it to be passed through. A tube 2m wide, 10m long can be created.

spell.name: Motes of Arden
spell.boost: +20 Caster and specified friends not affected

description.para: A swarm of dancing, brightly flashing motes are created which swarm around the target point, confusing anyone caught within the area. The area is up to 30m across, and anyone caught within it suffers a -20 penalty to actions.

The target of the spell is made translucent and semi-ethereal, though this only affects sentient creatures, so no clothing or equipment will be affected along with them. The target has difficulty moving. Normal air resists as if they were swimming in molasses, and maximum movement is agility metres per round. Solid objects, such as walls, can be moved through at about a tenth this speed. The target cannot be easily harmed - sword slashes etc will be felt as a stinging pain, but actual damage will only be done on a natural roll of 20. Affected targets cannot be larger than the wizard.

spell.name: Visions of Sheridyn
spell.boost: +40 Range is reach, affects one target

description.para: This spell creates powerful, vivid and invisible (subliminal) illusions. This is an extremely subtle spell used to help the caster in a conversation. The spell may be cast immediately prior to, or in the course of a conversation. Thereafter, while it is maintained, the caster can give the target brief illusion-flashes which tend to act directly on the subconscious. If properly used the subliminal effect can be profound. An experienced caster can convince almost anyone of anything. But in the hands of a novice, it is generally ineffective. It used to enhance the caster's guile, charm or trade skill, it adds +15 if a plausible argument is made.

A spell to find/summon ethereals. It will find the nearest ethereal entity, and the caster will have a general idea of its nature and strength. A contest of wills can be made to summon a found ethereal, and success means it is under the caster's control for the duration. If the caster can summon multiple ethereals, then there is a -1 penalty to will for trying to control each ethereal beyond the first.

A spell which allows the caster to increase or decrease the windforce in his immediate vicinity. The effect is local, so while it could be used to drive a single ship the caster is on, and it cannot be used to drive an entire fleet. Wind can be increased from still air to a gale force wind. It works best outside, where there is plenty of air available. Effects indoors are unpredictable.

Renders the caster translucent and ethereal. In this form he is immune to physical damage, but remains susceptible to enchantment. With the basic spell, the caster cannot achieve full etherealness. He can still feel events in the material world, but cannot affect them. He is not immune to physical harm, but injuries are always fatigue rather than body levels. Clothes and items carried can be affected by the spell, at the caster's option. If the caster can create a link item, then this is designated on casting and must be being touched. It remains physical, but can be affected by the caster. If it is taken from him, it can be used to harm him.

spell.name: Vapour of Hirin
spell.boost: +50 Time, between a day and a week, can be chosen
+100 A body level is healed every day while dematerialised

description.para: An enchantment to protect an object or person against harm by dematerialising it. The object evaporates within a round, and recombines between a day and a week later, at a point designated at the time of casting. Time of recombination is random, and the place must have been visited by the caster previously. Accuracy drops greatly with distance, though it is generally 'safe'. While dematerialised, the subject has no consciousness, and all enchantments on them are dropped.
